text: what has been the most significant
historic event in your lifetime Pew
Research recently posed this question to
Americans and some of the results are
pretty predictable but others they're
kind of surprising okay so check it out
here's the top tech let's just get
number one out of the way
that's the September 11th attacks it was
ranked first by Americans of all ages
then you've got those sort of ax where
were you when moments JFK's
assassination the moon landing the fall
of the Berlin Wall
there are also the wars that Americans
have fought in there's Vietnam of course
and the more recent conflicts in Iraq
and Afghanistan but now look at this
coming in at number 10 is the recent
massacre at an Orlando nightclub and
that's likely because of the influence
of Millennials so for this generation
they're significant events included
three mass shootings Orlando Plus
Columbine and Sandy Hook and actually
Americans from each generation mentioned
influential events other generations
didn't
so Generation X had the Challenger Space
Shuttle disaster and baby boomers had
the civil rights movement and the Silent
Generation of course noted World War two
but ok back to the overall top ten
number nine is gay marriage another
recent event that makes the list and
number three you have the tech
revolution which like 9/11 has made a
big impression on all generations and
finally the last one that's the election
of Barack Obama as president but what's
really interesting to know is that black
Americans were the only group to say
9/11 wasn't the most significant event
in their lifetime for them it was
Obama's election but significance
doesn't necessarily translate into
popularity pew also asked Americans when
they felt the most disappointed in their
